title: How to Make a Fringed Fleece Scarf

steps.headline: Buy 3 types of fleece at the craft store or online.
steps.description: If the fleece is 60" wide, you will only need ⁄3 yard (0.3 m) of each color, as long as the store clerk cuts straight, since each piece will be the exact cut of your scarf. You should choose fleece that has a similar thickness and pile. Each of the colors will show when the fringe is complete, so make sure they are complimentary colors. Buy complimentary thread for your sewing machine.

steps.headline: If you bought more than the minimum amount of fleece, cut 3 pieces of fleece with fabric scissors or a rotary cutter and a self-healing mat.
steps.description: They should be 5 feet (1.5 m) (1.5 m) long and 1 foot (0.30 m) (0.3 m) wide. You can easily make a themed scarf by using red, white and blue for the fourth of July or red, green and white for Christmas.

steps.headline: Align the 3 pieces of fabric exactly.
Place the top, middle section of the fleece beneath the presser foot.
steps.description: With a close stitch, sew down all 5 feet (1.5 m) (1.5 m) of fleece. Take care to sew straight and evenly, with a back stitch on both ends.

steps.headline: Lay the fleece strip on a craft table.
steps.description: Cut a slit in the side of the fleece every 1 inch (2.5 cm). Make sure to stop just before the center line.

steps.headline: Cut slits on the opposite side.
steps.description: Again, be careful to cut short of the sewed center line.

steps.headline: Fluff the fringes of the scarf so that all 3 layers show.
steps.description: It should become more full and ready to wear.
